scenes.voice: My wife threw away my entire Pokémon card collection because she said I was too old for it.
I’m 30 and have been collecting since I was a kid, some of them even from the 90s.
Some were worth money, but mostly they were sentimental, reminding me of my childhood.
I kept them neatly in binders on a shelf in my office.
A few days ago, I noticed they were gone, and when I asked my wife where they were, she told me she threw them out.
Her reason was that I’m a grown man and don’t need to play with kids’ stuff.
I honestly felt sick. She didn’t even ask, just binned something that’s been part of my life for decades.
When I got angry, she doubled down and said I should thank her for helping me move on.
scenes.overlay: She said I should thank her
